p: The compound 7-epiclusianone ( 12) found in the pericarp of G. brasiliensis fruits exhibited biological activity in vitro against trypomastigotes of Trypanosoma cruzi [ 9], and a potent vasodilatory effect on the endothelium [ 42]; antianaphylactic [ 43], anti-HIV [ 29], antimicrobial [ 5, 44, 45, 46], antispasmodic [ 39], antiproliferative [ 45], and leishmanicidal activities, have also been attributed to this benzophenone [ 21].
